Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: After angiography by the venous route in patient n degree 1 a biphasic reaction with an immediate reaction ( dyspnea , loss of consciousness ) and delayed macro - papular rash appeared , whilst patient n degree 2 developed a generalised sensation of heat , persistent pain at the site of injection immediately and a generalised macro - papular reaction after 24 hours .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| biphasic reaction |
| dyspnea |
| loss of consciousness |
| macro-papular rash |

The paragraph describes two patients (n degree 1 and n degree 2) experiencing different reactions after angiography by the venous route. The biphasic reaction is a general term used to describe the occurrence of both an immediate reaction (dyspnea and loss of consciousness) and a delayed reaction (macro-papular rash) in patient n degree 1. Patient n degree 2, on the other hand, experienced a generalized sensation of heat, persistent pain at the site of injection, and a macro-papular reaction after 24 hours. Therefore, the valid disease entities in the paragraph are biphasic reaction, dyspnea, loss of consciousness, and macro-papular rash.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| biphasic reaction |
| macro-papular rash |

The paragraph describes two patients experiencing different reactions after angiography by the venous route. Patient one had a biphasic reaction, which includes an immediate reaction (dyspnea and loss of consciousness) and a delayed reaction (macro-papular rash). However, dyspnea and loss of consciousness are symptoms of the immediate reaction and should not be considered separate diseases. Therefore, only macro-papular rash and biphasic reaction are valid disease entities in the paragraph.
